alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Lunenburg; Nottoway; Western Chesterfield (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Showers and isolated thunderstorms with heavy rain will impact portions of southeastern Lunenburg, southeastern Nottoway, western Dinwiddie, southeastern Amelia and Brunswick Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 113 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers and isolated thunderstorms along a line extending from near Blackstone to near Lawrenceville. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Rain 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Possible minor flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Showers and thunderstorms will be near... Blackstone and Fort Pickett around 120 PM EDT. Alberta, Wilsons and Spainville around 135 PM EDT. Mannboro around 155 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include North Wellville, Cochran, Irby, Gills Corner, Dolphin, Earls, Ammon, Forkland, Meredithville and Darvills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these showers and thunderstorms and may lead to localized minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Lunenburg; Nottoway; Western Chesterfield
